title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 June 2014 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
01:57 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
01:58 <vfzevaze> hi  
01:58 <vfzevaze> anayone aware of this error? Error waiting for multi-thread deployment of context descriptors to complete java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.StackOverflowError  
01:58 <vfzevaze> just updated xwiki via apt and got this blocker  
01:58 <vfzevaze> please help  
02:50 <vfzevaze> just solved it by replacing the /var/lib/xwiki/data/extension/repository with the one from the release...  
03:06 <vfzevaze> has left #xwiki  
05:05 <teekay> has joined #xwiki  
05:42 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <polx> has quit  
06:18 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
06:25 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
07:08 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:28 <teekay> Hi guys, was wondering how to delete a page you were 'watching' when that page/space/wiki has been deleted as a normal user  
07:28 <teekay> as in, remove it from your watchlist\*\*  
07:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:43 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <teekay> Hi guys, was wondering how to delete a page from your watchlist when that page or space/wiki it belonged to has been deleted as a normal user? Seems to not work if you try from your watchlist preferences  
07:56 <evalica> teekay: have you tried removing it manually from the Object Editor on the user's Profile page?  
08:23 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
08:38 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <teekay> evalica: thanks that worked. looks like i'll have to write a procedure on that one for our users..  
09:32 <evalica> teekay: k :)  
09:41 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, what piece of code is handling adding / modifying objects in app within minutes? (currently, date field ignores user timezone, which is not desirable, especially with applications like calendar)  
10:21 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ: is there a date field in XWiki with timezone ? I think the common "Date" field has not time zone, and it is up to the application to handle this, if wanted ... I have to admit I did not look into that closely  
10:23 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: that's the problem, there is no date field with timezone, although users have timezone -> if user with different timezone inputs date, the date is saved as if it was in default timezone  
10:23 <ClemensR> aside of that AppWithMinutes created applications are not that special to "manually" created ones, you get a "class sheet" for every class displaying the instances of the application  
10:24 <ClemensR> I am trying to remember how to customize the save action for the edit view ....  
10:27 <DarkKnightCZ> there is possibility of adding listener to those events (document created/updated   /  xobject add/update), but what is the point of having user timezone and using it only for viewing? If user is in different timezone, he won't be thinking of shifting his time to correct timezone (although there could be some notifications)  
10:29 <ClemensR> ... ah I confused it with "Validation" ... like in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Creating+a+form+with+validation+and+tooltips  ... its pretty old but still works.  
10:30 <ClemensR> in principle you can add the timezone in the display, and if a user edits an object, then in the save listener you can subtract the tie zone again  
10:31 <ClemensR> I have to admit this "manually housekeeping" looks annoying ... not sure if there is a better way, though  
10:32 <DarkKnightCZ> yup, thanks  
10:37 <ClemensR> come to think about  I guess you are maybe better off with a "DocumentCreatingEvent / DocumentUpdatingEvent" listener instead of a Validator ... it is possible to "adjust" values in a validator, but it a bit odd ... listener like e.g http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module+Local#HWritinganEventListenerinGroovyinaWikipage  
10:38 <ClemensR> er, I meant: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingEventListenerTutorial  
10:40 <DarkKnightCZ> yup, i know about event listeners, but i still think this functionality should be in core (so every datetime showing / updating will consider user timezone)  
10:48 <tmortagne> I plan the start the 6.1RC1 release in about half an hour  
10:48 <tmortagne> ok for everyone ?  
10:49 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: nothing in your todo regarding bug you fixed yesterday ?  
10:49 <evalica> tmortagne: k - thanks for notice - nothing on my part  
10:49 <gdelhumeau> nope, I have checked this morning that all needed unit tests are already written  
10:52 <gdelhumeau> and IE9 works  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> IE11 is supposed to be very clode to the web standards  
10:54 <tmortagne> at last :)  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> but ahain we have to do specific hack to make it work...  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10514  
10:54 <tmortagne> nice one  
10:55 <tmortagne> :)  
11:15 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ: you can extend the  com.xpn.xwiki.objects.classes.DataClass for that, and overwriting the fromString and toFormString  methods ... like http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/CreatingNewXClassPropertyTypes  
11:16 <ClemensR> I guess the core does not do that because it has no idea from where to get the time zone  
11:16 <ClemensR> patching the existing  DateClass might be tricky due to b/w compat issues ...  
11:17 <ClemensR> (oh, and s/classes.DataClass/classes.DateClass/ of coutre)  
11:23 <tmortagne> starting the 6.1RC1 release  
11:36 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: yes, i looked at that, sadly there isn't any good way how to obtain that timezone  
11:39 <ClemensR> yes, thats the problem ;)  you could write a @Component, which uses a  Provider<XWikiContext> contextProvider ... and so on, somewhat similar to the com.xpn.xwiki.internal.localization.XWikiLocalizationContext  
11:39 <ClemensR> I am afraid it is not going to be easier that that ...  
12:24 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: well, i guess there  
12:24 <DarkKnightCZ> is some piece of code between frontend and baseobject calling  
12:24 <DarkKnightCZ> so it could be done there  
12:31 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ: ah, I did not know that such a thing exists (especially for the "getter" ... I guess if a script calls that, it might be tricky to catch it)  
12:36 <DarkKnightCZ> yes.. well, i will try to do it somehow :)  
12:40 <Slashman> has quit

15:55 <gdelhumeau> yep

23:44 <moviuro> has joined #xwiki  
23:46 <abusenius> has quit  
23:47 <moviuro> Hi there! XWiki messes up some simple things like, say, code: http://paste.kde.org/p6eleyi0j gives: http://wstaw.org/m/2014/06/24/plasma-desktopQmE669.png : why aren't both code exactly the same thing with header box and so on?  
23:58 <moviuro> hmmmm, actually, it's even worse: it's just random, sometimes it's messed up, sometimes it isn't...
